_[other/pkgconfig/toxav.pc.in, line 8 [r1]](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/toxcore/31#-KOwN01bBwIF4j9RgA_9:-KOwN01bBwIF4j9RgA_A:bxb2qkp) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/toxcore/blob/e86d8de9319ed6fa1ba086e3d007bb698854813f/other/pkgconfig/toxav.pc.in#L8)):_

> ```
> Description: Tox A/V library
> Requires: opus toxcore vpx
> Version: @PROJECT_VERSION@
> ```

is @PROJECT_VERSION@ going to be the ToxAV version, or the toxcore version?

Say a compile flag or something. --- _[other/pkgconfig/toxav.pc.in, line 8 [r1]](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/toxcore/31#-KOwN01bBwIF4j9RgA_9:-KOxo-kCewvPQSYZflJl:bgxs3cb) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/toxcore/blob/e86d8de9319ed6fa1ba086e3d007bb698854813f/other/pkgconfig/toxav.pc.in#L8)):_

> In addition to that, perhaps explicitly make it clear by declaring it as `PROJECT_AV_VERSION` or `PROJECT_CORE_VERSION` or names of that liking. --- _[other/pkgconfig/toxcore.pc.in, line 8 [r1]](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/toxcore/31#-KOxt13lfeHf3q_hEZHg:-KOxt13lfeHf3q_hEZHh:b-3yrnde) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/toxcore/blob/e86d8de9319ed6fa1ba086e3d007bb698854813f/other/pkgconfig/toxcore.pc.in#L8)):_ > ``` > Description: Tox protocol library > Requires: libsodium > Version: @PROJECT_VERSION@ > ``` See my suggestion after GrayHatter's comment above regarding unambiguous version vars, not a big deal though. --- _[other/pkgconfig/toxdns.pc.in, line 8 [r1]](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/toxcore/31#-KOxtKk73TWIeEXmcPNF:-KOxtKk73TWIeEXmcPNG:bptkxzz) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/toxcore/blob/e86d8de9319ed6fa1ba086e3d007bb698854813f/other/pkgconfig/toxdns.pc.in#L8)):_ > ``` > Description: Tox DNS3 library > Requires: toxcore > Version: @PROJECT_VERSION@ > ``` See my suggestion after GrayHatter's comment above regarding unambiguous version vars. --- _[other/pkgconfig/toxencryptsave.pc.in, line 8 [r1]](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/toxcore/31#-KOxtLtS8xo9H5fuD7_N:-KOxtLtS8xo9H5fuD7_O:bptkxzz) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/toxcore/blob/e86d8de9319ed6fa1ba086e3d007bb698854813f/other/pkgconfig/toxencryptsave.pc.in#L8)):_ > ``` > Description: Tox block encryption library > Requires: toxcore > Version: @PROJECT_VERSION@ > ``` See my suggestion after GrayHatter's comment above regarding unambiguous version vars. --- _[other/travis/autotools-script, line 21 [r1]](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/toxcore/31#-KOxrx6OV0kcJhGAywRG:-KOxrx6OV0kcJhGAywRH:broet6g) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/toxcore/blob/e86d8de9319ed6fa1ba086e3d007bb698854813f/other/travis/autotools-script#L21)):_ > ``` > # do care whether it configures/builds at all, which is exercised by the make > # call above. Tests are executed by the cmake build. > make distcheck -j `nproc` || true > ``` If this is to run, I suggest echoing at least a part of the comment above such that future log-dwellers don't get alarmed by this failure. A simple ``` echo "The following step may fail, see: ``` Or even better, if it fails (change to a if-condition) , print a clean "fail ignored" error message --- _[other/travis/hstox-after_script, line 3 [r1]](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/toxcore/31#-KOxqV_RX5rO7o9ejMHc:-KOxqV_SswqZtYNExLHM:bjwu6ht) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/toxcore/blob/e86d8de9319ed6fa1ba086e3d007bb698854813f/other/travis/hstox-after_script#L3)):_ > ``` > #!/bin/sh > > set -e -x > ``` This can be changed to `set -e -u -x` to guard against uninitialized vars from being used. (I've tested a travis build with `-u`, doesn't seem to cause issues). --- _[other/travis/hstox-install, line 3 [r1]](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/toxcore/31#-KOxqc8VWk1rHo3RY2fV:-KOxqc8VWk1rHo3RY2fW:b-mv518n) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/toxcore/blob/e86d8de9319ed6fa1ba086e3d007bb698854813f/other/travis/hstox-install#L3)):_ > ``` > #!/bin/sh > > set -e -x > ``` Same as above, change to `set -e -u -x`. > Same as above: next time no need to copy-paste to every instance. --- _Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/toxcore/31)_

I only reviewed travis & scripts part, since I don't know about CMake or pkgconfig stuff.

Aside from what I've commented on, there are some inconsistencies with how number of build jobs is set – e.g. in `toxcore-install.sh` dependencies are compiled with

```
-j3
```

while in other places 

```
-j `nproc`
```

is used. Personally, I think that `-j$(nproc)` should be used instead of the above mentioned.

AFAIK using `$()` instead of backticks is preferable.

---

_[other/travis/autotools-script, line 10 [r5]](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/toxcore/31#-KOzjLPWfs-ebo6dZmzA:-KOzjLPWfs-ebo6dZmzB:bmv9idf) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/toxcore/blob/bbb157dc97ede8472e60e7b73fd149a6d299abb0/other/travis/autotools-script#L10)):_

> ./configure \
>   --with-libsodium-libs=$CACHE_DIR/lib \
>   --with-libsodium-headers=$CACHE_DIR/include \
> ```

Perhaps include dir also should be sourced in `env.sh`?

_[other/travis/autotools-script, line 15 [r5]](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/toxcore/31#-KOzio-EwLM5AQe4-zRt:-KOzio-EwLM5AQe4-zRu:bjku24b) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/toxcore/blob/bbb157dc97ede8472e60e7b73fd149a6d299abb0/other/travis/autotools-script#L15)):_

> ```
>   --enable-ntox
> 
> make -j `nproc`
> ```

if `env-$ENV.sh` is sourced, shouldn't `$MAKE` be used?

Same would go for other `*install.sh` and `*script.sh`, unless I misunderstood the purpose of sourcing `$MAKE`?

---

_[other/travis/env.sh, line 7 [r5]](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/toxcore/31#-KOzgqI9SAfIpH5_iHH1:-KOzgqIAEvSLslUC2_fo:bwpm6yr) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/toxcore/blob/bbb157dc97ede8472e60e7b73fd149a6d299abb0/other/travis/env.sh#L7)):_

> export OPAMROOT=$CACHE_DIR/.opam
> export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=$CACHE_DIR/lib
> export PKG_CONFIG_PATH=$CACHE_DIR/lib/pkgconfig
> ```

`s,$CACHE_DIR/lib/,$LD_LIBRARY_PATH/,` ?

I've changed it. --- Review status: 7 of 16 files reviewed at latest revision, 19 unresolved discussions, some commit checks failed. --- _[other/travis/autotools-script, line 9 [r5]](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/toxcore/31#-KOzj1elNchZNyE6UC9v:-KP-445dbNDwS-AeFY_v:b1k6xbp) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/toxcore/blob/bbb157dc97ede8472e60e7b73fd149a6d299abb0/other/travis/autotools-script#L9)):_
Previously, zetok wrote… > `s,$CACHE_DIR/lib,$LD_LIBRARY_PATH,` ? >
> $LD_LIBRARY_PATH is not a single path, but rather a `:`-separated list of lookup paths like $PATH. --- _[other/travis/autotools-script, line 10 [r5]](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/toxcore/31#-KOzjLPWfs-ebo6dZmzA:-KP-4GD9LOyg121AU_HE:b9gglby) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/toxcore/blob/bbb157dc97ede8472e60e7b73fd149a6d299abb0/other/travis/autotools-script#L10)):_
Previously, zetok wrote… > Perhaps include dir also should be sourced in `env.sh`? >
> You mean like $INCLUDE_DIR? I would prefer not to have too many variables. The include dir should always be at $CACHE_DIR/include. It doesn't make sense to hide that behind another variable. --- _[other/travis/autotools-script, line 15 [r5]](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/toxcore/31#-KOzio-EwLM5AQe4-zRt:-KP-4Y5fbETO8JlT1mkE:bgprx57) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/toxcore/blob/bbb157dc97ede8472e60e7b73fd149a6d299abb0/other/travis/autotools-script#L15)):_
Previously, zetok wrote… > if `env-$ENV.sh` is sourced, shouldn't `$MAKE` be used? > > Same would go for other `*install.sh` and `*script.sh`, unless I misunderstood the purpose of sourcing `$MAKE`? >
> $MAKE is for cross compilation only. --- _[other/travis/env.sh, line 7 [r5]](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/toxcore/31#-KOzgqI9SAfIpH5_iHH1:-KP-4cuij3Rps2PYrpoX:b-q64pkt) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/toxcore/blob/bbb157dc97ede8472e60e7b73fd149a6d299abb0/other/travis/env.sh#L7)):_
Previously, zetok wrote… > `s,$CACHE_DIR/lib/,$LD_LIBRARY_PATH/,` ? >
> See above. --- _Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/toxcore/31#-:-KP-3xDow9SJ4M42KA_Q:b2k5plu)_

I think the naming scheme could be improved, but doesn't need to be. --- Review status: 7 of 16 files reviewed at latest revision, 20 unresolved discussions. --- _[CMakeLists.txt, line 140 [r1]](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/toxcore/31#-KOxzYFwQdS9UCLBM6gc:-KP-51IzFO9r12g3tYZz:bz17etm) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/toxcore/blob/e86d8de9319ed6fa1ba086e3d007bb698854813f/CMakeLists.txt#L140)):_
Previously, iphydf wrote… > I don't know whether it will, but currently it has none, so there is no linking required. I don't know the future of toxdns and I'm not terribly interested in it right now. I'm also not going to extend these tests. The toktok testing project works differently. >
> No toxdns will never get tests. ToxDNS is around for legacy support. And will be dropped as soon as we can replace it with something else. --- _Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/toxcore/31#-:-KOwPnKE9tqnmlbcVFmK:b-ctmi6n)_

I use a very similar setup on qtox. My plan is to continue doing this for a bit and then extract common logic from both, fix a naming scheme, and make it a "travis-xenv" (cross compile environment) repository that is used by both.

---
